start.description: A derivation tree for $G=(V,T,S,P)$ is built by setting the root node label to $S$.
start.question: We always start deriving a string from the grammar's start variable

children.description:
A derivation tree for $G=(V,T,S,P)$ is built by setting the root node label to $S$.
The children of a node will be the RHS of the production rule that we use to derive the string.
children.question: The children for any node can be variables and/or terminals

leaf.description:
A derivation tree for $G=(V,T,S,P)$ is built by setting the root node label to $S$.
The children of a node will be the RHS of the production rule that we need to use to derive the string.
Leaves are labeled $x$, where $x\in T\cup \{\lambda \}$
leaf.question: The leaf nodes can be variables and/or terminals

nonleaf.description:
A derivation tree for $G=(V,T,S,P)$ is built by setting the root node label to $S$
The children of a node will be the RHS of the production rule that we need to use to derive the string.
Leaves are labeled $x$, where $x\in T\cup \{\lambda \}$
Non-leaf vertices are labeled $A$, where $A\in V$
nonleaf.question: The non-leaf nodes will be variables

partial.description: Definition: A partial derivation tree is a subtree of a derivation tree.
partial.question: The tree on the left is

partialder.description:
Definition: A partial derivation tree is a subtree of a derivation tree.
If a partial derivation tree has root $S$ then it represents a sentential form.
partialder.question: What is the sentential form equivalent to the partial derivation tree on the left?

yield.description:
Definition: A partial derivation tree is a subtree of a derivation tree.
If a partial derivation tree has root $S$ then it represents a sentential form.
A listing of the leaves from left to right in a derivation tree generates the yield of the tree.
yield.question: What is the yield for the partial derivation tree on the left?

fullorpart.description:
Definition: A partial derivation tree is a subtree of a derivation tree.
If a partial derivation tree has root $S$ then it represents a sentential form.
A listing of the leaves from left to right in a derivation tree generates the yield of the tree.
fullorpart.question: The tree on the left is

lastyield.description:
Definition: A partial derivation tree is a subtree of a derivation tree.
If a partial derivation tree has root $S$ then it represents a sentential form.
A listing of the leaves from left to right in a derivation tree generates the yield of the tree.
lastyield.question: What is the yield for the derivation tree on the left?

inlang.description:
Definition: A partial derivation tree is a subtree of a derivation tree.
If a partial derivation tree has root $S$ then it represents a sentential form.
A listing of the leaves from left to right in a derivation tree generates the yield of the tree.
If $w$ is the yield of a derivation tree, then it must be that $w\in L(G)$.
inlang.question: Since the string $aac$ is the yield of the tree, then $aac \in L(G)$
